Religious Leaders.name: Guru Nanak Dev Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Founder of Sikhism and the first Sikh Guru.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Angad Dev Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Second Sikh Guru, known for creating the Gurmukhi script.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Amar Das Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Third Sikh Guru, known for establishing Langar (community kitchen).

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Ram Das Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Fourth Sikh Guru, founder of Amritsar.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Arjan Dev Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Fifth Sikh Guru and compiler of the Adi Granth.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Hargobind Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Sixth Sikh Guru, known for militarizing Sikhs.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Har Rai Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Seventh Sikh Guru, focused on compassion and healing.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Har Krishan Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Eighth Sikh Guru, known as the child Guru.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Ninth Sikh Guru, martyred for protecting religious freedom.

Religious Leaders.name: Guru Gobind Singh Ji
Religious Leaders.description: Tenth Sikh Guru, founder of the Khalsa.

Freedom Fighters.name: Udham Singh
Freedom Fighters.description: Assassinated Michael O'Dwyer to avenge the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

Freedom Fighters.name: Kartar Singh Sarabha
Freedom Fighters.description: Member of the Ghadar Party and early freedom fighter.

Freedom Fighters.name: Lala Lajpat Rai
Freedom Fighters.description: Leader of the Indian independence movement, known as Punjab Kesari.

Freedom Fighters.name: Sohan Singh Bhakna
Freedom Fighters.description: Founding leader of the Ghadar Party.

Rulers and Warriors.name: Maharaja Ranjit Singh
Rulers and Warriors.description: Founder of the Sikh Empire, known as the 'Lion of Punjab.'

Rulers and Warriors.name: Hari Singh Nalwa
Rulers and Warriors.description: Commander-in-chief of the Sikh Khalsa Army under Maharaja Ranjit Singh.

Rulers and Warriors.name: Jassa Singh Ahluwalia
Rulers and Warriors.description: Sikh leader and founder of the Ahluwalia Misal.

Rulers and Warriors.name: Banda Singh Bahadur
Rulers and Warriors.description: Sikh warrior and leader who established Sikh rule in Punjab.

Rulers and Warriors.name: Mai Bhago
Rulers and Warriors.description: Female Sikh warrior who led Sikh soldiers against the Mughals.

Poets and Writers.name: Bulleh Shah
Poets and Writers.description: Sufi poet known for his spiritual and philosophical poetry.

Poets and Writers.name: Waris Shah
Poets and Writers.description: Author of the Punjabi epic 'Heer Ranjha.'

Poets and Writers.name: Bhai Gurdas Ji
Poets and Writers.description: Early Sikh scholar and poet, writer of Vaaran Bhai Gurdas.

Poets and Writers.name: Shiv Kumar Batalvi
Poets and Writers.description: Modern Punjabi poet known for his romantic and melancholic poetry.

Poets and Writers.name: Amrita Pritam
Poets and Writers.description: Renowned Punjabi writer and poet, author of Pinjar.

Prominent Women.name: Rani Jindan (Maharani Jind Kaur)
Prominent Women.description: Queen regent of the Sikh Empire and mother of Duleep Singh.

Prominent Women.name: Bibi Bhani Ji
Prominent Women.description: Daughter of Guru Amar Das Ji and mother of Guru Arjan Dev Ji.

Prominent Women.name: Bibi Nanaki Ji
Prominent Women.description: Elder sister of Guru Nanak Dev Ji, known for her support and devotion.

Prominent Women.name: Mai Bhago
Prominent Women.description: Female Sikh warrior who led Sikh soldiers against the Mughals.
